name: (1E)-N,N'-bis(4-methylphenyl)-2-[(4-methylphenyl)amino]ethanimidamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3193
Reason: 1E-N,N'-bis(4-methylphenyl)-2-[(4-methylphenyl)amino]ethanimidamide has a melting point that can be analyzed by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is ethanimidamide, which has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius. The methylphenyl group (C1CCCC1) adds approximately +20 due to increasing the molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. The 4-methylphenyl group (C1CCCC1) adds approximately +20 due to adding more rigidity to the structure. The amino group (N) adds approximately +10 due to the presence of a basic nitrogen, which can participate in hydrogen bonding. The piperidine ring (N1CCCC1) and 1-ethyl-4-methylenepiperidine moiety may both add roughly +20 each due to adding more rigid ring structures and making the molecule more compact. The methyl group (C) adds approximately +5 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure.
